summary: THE TRANSMISSION ON MY 1996 DODGE CARAVAN HAS FAILED AGAIN FOR THE THIRD TIME.    IT WAS REPLACED ONCE IN 1997 AT 7,000 MILES BY CHRYSLER.  IT WAS RECONDITIONED IN 2000 AT 56,000 MILES BY CHRYSLER.  THE MOST RECENT FAILURE AT 81,000 MILES IN DECEMBER OF 2002.  CHRYSLER REFUSES TO ACKNOWLEDGE A PROBLEM WITH THE TRANSMISSION AND REFUSES TO PERFORM ANY "GOOD WILL" REPAIRS.
